Package student

Class Roster

  • java.lang.Object
    • student.Roster
  • public class Roster
extends java.lang.Object
    Container class defines the array list data structure to hold the student roster.
    Author:
    David Halim, Stephen Juan.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private static int DEFAULT_SIZE  
      private int size  
      private Student[] students  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Roster()
      Default constructor initializes size of students array to DEFAULT_SIZE.
      Roster​(int studentsSize)
      Overloaded constructor initializes size of students array and size.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_SIZE

        private static final int DEFAULT_SIZE
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • students

        private Student[] students

      • size

        private int size

    • Constructor Detail

      • Roster

        public Roster()
        Default constructor initializes size of students array to DEFAULT_SIZE. DEFAULT_SIZE is a static final int = 10. Calls the Overloaded constructor passing the value DEFAULT_SIZE. Initializes size = 0 (empty roster).

      • Roster

        public Roster​(int studentsSize)
        Overloaded constructor initializes size of students array and size. Initializes size of students array to an accepted value studentsSize. Initializes size = 0 (empty roster).
        Parameters:
        studentsSize - accepted value for size of students array.

    • Method Detail

      • find

        private int find​(Student student)
        find the student index, or return (-1) NOT_FOUND.
        Parameters:
        student - to be found.
        Returns:
        index if found, returns -1 otherwise.

      • grow

        private void grow()
        increase the capacity of the array list by 4

      • add

        public boolean add​(Student student)
        Adds an student to the roster. Calls find(student) to make sure the new does not exist in the array to eliminate duplicates.
        Parameters:
        student - to add to the roster
        Returns:
        true if the add is successful, false if the student already exists in the roster.

      • remove

        public boolean remove​(Student student)
        Removes an student from the roster. Calls find(student) to get the index to remove. Maintains the current sequence of students in the array after the deletion.
        Parameters:
        student - to remove from the roster.
        Returns:
        true if the remove is successful, false if the student does not exist in the class.

      • print

        public java.lang.String print()
        Prints out the list without specifying the order.
        Returns:
        print the string to print

      • mergeByStudentNames

        private void mergeByStudentNames​(int first,
                                 int middlePoint,
                                 int last)
        Merges 2 sublists and sort them in the order of student names.
        Parameters:
        first - - index of the first element of the right sublist to be merged
        middlePoint - - index of the last element of the right sublist to be merged
        last - - index of the last element of the left sublist to be merged

      • mergeByPaymentDate

        private void mergeByPaymentDate​(int first,
                                int middlePoint,
                                int last)
        Merges 2 sublists and sort them in the order of Payment Date.
        Parameters:
        first - - index of the first element of the right sublist to be merged
        middlePoint - - index of the last element of the right sublist to be merged
        last - - index of the last element of the left sublist to be merged

      • sort

        private void sort​(int first,
                  int last,
                  int sortingType)
        Recursive sort method that sorts the list using merge sort. Splits the every list/sublist into 2 halves until the lists reach size 1. It merges in the order of Student Name or LastPaymentDate according to int sortingType.
        Parameters:
        first - - index of the first element of the list/sublist to be sorted
        last - - index of the last element of the list/sublist to be sorted
        sortingType - represents the type of merge sorting; 0 = mergeByStudentNames 1 = mergeByPaymentDate.

      • printByStudentNames

        public java.lang.String printByStudentNames()
        Prints out the list in the order of Student Names.
        Returns:
        print the string to print

      • printByPaymentDate

        public java.lang.String printByPaymentDate()
        Prints out the list in the order of Payment Date.
        Returns:
        print the string to print

      • calculateTuition

        public void calculateTuition()
        Calculates tuition due for all students in the roster.

      • payTuition

        public void payTuition​(Student student,
                       Date paymentDate,
                       float payment)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Allows a student in the roster to make a payment. Calls find(student) to get the index to make the payment.
        Parameters:
        student - to pay tuition.
        paymentDate - to specify the payment date.
        payment - to specify the payment amount.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if Student is not in the roster, Amount is greater than amount due.

      • setStudyAbroad

        public boolean setStudyAbroad​(Student student,
                              boolean studyAbroad)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Allows an International student in the roster to be in the Study Abroad program. Calls find(student) to get the index of the student.
        Parameters:
        student - to be in the Study Abroad program.
        studyAbroad - value of study abroad (true or false).
        Returns:
        true if the setStudyAbroad is successful, false if the student does not exist in the class.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if Student is not international.

      • setFinancialAid

        public boolean setFinancialAid​(Student student,
                               float aid)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Set the financial aid amount for a resident student. Calls find(student) to get the index of the student.
        Parameters:
        student - to get financial aid.
        aid - value to be given.
        Returns:
        true if the setFinancialAid is successful, false if the student does not exist in the class.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if Financial aid amount is invalid, Student is not a resident student.
